intro: Stigmaphyllon umbellatum, commonly known as the Brazilian shield fern, is a perennial evergreen plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a water-holding cup. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in an umbel, giving it its scientific name. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
